wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Close  (12 February 1796 – 25 January 1881) was an English antiquarian and archaeologist.

link_mentions.page: List of fellows of the Society of Antiquaries of London

response: In 1871, the Bedfrdshire Mercury said that the ornamentation was in "Darley Dale, Mansfield stone, and Aberdeen granite ... the general effect is one of great elegance." The eight coats of arms were supplied by Thomas Close and sculptured by W.P. Smith of Nottingham, and Mawer & Ingle were credited for the "general carving."The Engineer 22 January 1869 Editorial about bridge plans, with illustrations (paywall)
